headline: Chicken Salad with Bacon, Lettuce, and Tomato
description: This chicken salad with bacon and tomato is dressed in a creamy mixture of mayonnaise, lemon juice, and parsley and served over crisp lettuce leaves.

video.description: Kickin' chicken BLT salad, oh my!
video.name: Chicken Salad with Bacon, Lettuce, and Tomato

name: Chicken Salad with Bacon, Lettuce, and Tomato
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Cook bacon in a large skillet and over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned and crispy, about 10 minutes. Drain on paper towels and crumble when cool enough to handle.
Whisk mayonnaise, green onion, parsley, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and black pepper together in a bowl until smooth.
Stir chicken, tomato, and celery together in a bowl. Add crumbled bacon; pour mayonnaise dressing over top and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate until chilled, at least 30 minutes.
When ready to serve, remove from the refrigerator and stir. Serve over romaine lettuce leaves and garnish with avocado slices.

review.reviewBody: I halved the recipe, there's just 2 of us. I also added croutons right before serving. It is very tasty and does taste like a BLT. This will be made again, this time for the 6 servings and maybe some cheese. That was last night, I forgot to submit. I made it AGAIN for the 2nd night in a row. I added some cubed cheddar cheese and a little onion powder to the dressing.
Absolutely perfect! A great spring salad for Sunday afternoons.
Ok but not a favorite. Needs more seasoning and does not save well.

Skipped the tomato, added leftover green peppers and cucumbers. Also added olive oil and extra lemon juice because the mixture was thick. I had a very ripe avocado, so I mixed it into the dressing. Delicious!
A weekly rotation in our house. Excellent for a quick lunch and my young kids love it (which is rare). I use rotisserie chicken to speed up the process. Delicious!

Made a couple of adjustments because of what I had on hand. I used 5 Tbsp real bacon bits, 3 cups diced rotisserie chicken, 1 cup minced green pepper (in place of celery), +/- ¾ cup mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons minced frozen onion, 1 tsp dried parsley, 1 teaspoon lemon juice, 1 dash Worcestershire sauce, and salt and ground black pepper to taste.
I sliced the tomato and topped sandwiches with it when serving, along with romaine lettuce. We ate it on mini croissants, and everyone loved it!!
Excellent

Really yummy! I like spicy stuff, so next time I make it I will probably spice the chicken up while it cooks. Totally love this dish though. Maybe I will also add more lemon juice on top of the whole salad. I lunch a bit more of a punch to things but this salad was super yummy. Two thumbs up!
Loved this recipe! Cut the tomatoes down to one tomato but that’s just my preference. Delicious!

This was very tasty, and my husband and son gave it 2 thumbs up. Next time I make it, I think I’ll decrease the mayo to 1/2 cup instead of 3/4. The tomato in the recipe adds extra moisture so the overall consistency was a bit too juicy for my taste. Also, I think I’ll chill it for a bit longer, which may absorb some of the liquid. I used Vidalia onion instead of green, bacon bits instead of strips. I’ll use bacon strips next time to give it a bigger bacon punch, although this recipe would be tasty even without bacon. Great summer salad.
I thought this was great. I added less mayo. I didn't add celery. I added some sliced sweet gherkin pickles, some pickle relish, a golden delicious apple, and crushed walnuts.

Made this as written and it was outstanding! Tasted just like a great BLT sandwich. The only thing I found was it was a little thick, so added a bit more lemon juice to thin it out a bit. I also skipped the avocado as this is something I'm not that big a fan of.

If you want to make this a touch healthier, substitute Plain Greek Yogurt for the mayo. I just made a batch of the dressing with yogurt, juice of half a lemon and 1% milk to get the consistency right and it is superb! In a carton in my fridge for lunch salads and a veggie dip!

Thanks for a great recipe!
spread the avocado onto a ww bread, sliced the tomato, and had a open faced sandwich
Very tasty and usable on my Keto adventure! I added some cashews and served in with some salad greens. Yum!
This may be our new favorite summer salad. You don't just have to use romaine lettuce, this goes well with any type of salad green or great as a wrap.
My husband and I loved it!
my wife gave it a 2 thumbs up... very easy to make, change one thing, only.... i had no avocados, and did have boiled eggs. So put 2 in the the dish....delicious.. so much protein..
My husband loved this. He is not one for change but this recipe changed his mind about chicken salad.
This is a great chicken salad recipe. The bacon is a delicious addition.
Very yummy, love this chicken salad
Delicious! Followed recipe exactly. For personal preference, next time I will increase the mayo by at least half.
A great low carb meal! Consider switching the parsley for cilantro and add cucumbers, cubed green apples and a dash of curry powder...yummy in my tummy.
Love the dressing. I didn't have any lemon so I used Lemon Pepper and some lime juice. Turned out very well. Next time I will have to add more bacon and it will be perfect. Everyone enjoyed it.
never tried anything like this, but IT WAS TO DIE FOR
One of the best recipes that I have tried from this site. Everyone raves about it. Great summertime salad. Fresh and crunchy and DELICIOUS!!!!
I made this for potluck today. Everyone Loved it.
It's was perfect! Family loved it

This is a great summer salad with good flavor. I think it needs a generous portion of salt and next time I think I'll add something to add crunch...seeds or croutons. I used leftover grilled chicken and leftover pork tenderloin as my meat. Added a few more avocados because we love them. The bowl was gone at the end of the night. Husband and two teen aged boys all loved it.
excellent salad nice and cool and refreshing on a hot humid day??
For a little extra zip add hot peppers
i made this as written-- and it is super good-- but maybe a little runny?? i seeded the tomatoes and everything. But i definitely will make it again-- thank you

I mixed Miracle Whip with sour cream for the dressing and added a little garlic powder and garlic salt. I used no regular salt. I tore the romaine leaves and made it like regular salad and served it in a salad bowl.
Made it exactly as the recipe stated and it was a big hit. Will definitely make it again.
No it was perfect!! Great for a summer meal in Texas!
I didn't have a tomato to put in the salad - but it was great! Would have even been better with the tomato!
Extremely delicious!!!! I had on wheat crackers and sometimes lettuce!!! I don’t care if you use a quality canned chicken or fresh! Recommend to everyone to change up an all too boring dish !!

Could be good, but you'd have to play with the seasoning. I thought it was rather bland. Miracle Whip would probably help or adding a bit of sugar. Has potential, but was not impressed with this version of the recipe.

Of course I couldn't follow the recipe. Is that even allowed? No romaine in the house. I was really looking for a recipe that I could use up the chicken I had thawed for last night and not cooked. Since we were going for a bike ride, it had to be picnic-able, so I went for a chicken salad. I marinaded my chicken breasts for 45 minutes or so in lemon juice with a dash of Worcestershire, then grilled and diced them.I burned the bacon because I was trying to do too many things at once, but it didn't hurt anything. I did have parsley, green onions, and tomato, so I used them along with some red cabbage that clamored to be included. No mayo, so the dressing became a dash of brown mustard, a couple dollops of miracle whip, some Ken's Vidalia Onion dressing, and some Beets All Ranch dressing. Added some grated parmesan just because parmesan. At the picnic table we wrapped them in tortillas and devoured them. Thanks for the inspiration and guidance! My wife insisted that I add this to my favorites.
This wasn’t a family favorite. I added a little more seasoning because it was bland.
Next time I'll use less green onions. I added the avocado into the salad.
This is the tastiest chicken salad I ever made. I used canned chicken breast and it was super good!
i added some chopped apple & nuts. it was great the original way also. cant wait to make it again.
Me & my friends loved it! Thank you!
I made this tonight and it came out awesome! I didn’t have precooked chicken so I cooked some chicken breasts after seasoning them with some lemon pepper. I will be making this again for sure!

Still a bit of a newbie in the kitchen but made this tonight in about 45 minutes top-to-bottom and it was a hit. Tried it on both a slider bun and on a bed of spinach--both were great. This is definitely going in the repeat pile.
everyone loves it Simple easy to make I recommend this recipe
added some chopped green pepper and left-over corn. LOVED IT!
I made this recipe exactly as stated. It was delicious and very easy to make, especially if you use some pre-made rotisserie chicken.
Thought it added great taste to my chicken salad. Was a perfect match for each other.
We loved it. Substituted spinach, used while pound bacon and used sour cream. Definitely a keeper

I made this chicken salad and I loved it! It was a light dinner but very satisfying. I made it on whole wheat toast instead of the Romain lettuce and omitted the celery because my husband doesn’t like it. I was considering leaving out the bacon...but
everything is better with bacon! 
Thanks for this delicious recipe.
This was delicious! I doubled the recipe and added a little more green onion and parsley. It was superb and can’t wait to make it again.
This recipe was great. I made it almost as written but used cooked rotisserie chicken. Will be making again.

This recipe is fantastic. I made it for two and only adjusted the salt and pepper. I however added a little bit more of lemon juice. It is perfect! As someone suggested, it is a great fill for a wrap. This recipe is a winner and a very good summer recipe. I will make it again!
I use whatever green leaf salad I have on hand (endive, red or green leaf lettuce, etc)

Good Recipe! Like so many AllRecipe followers certain new recipes "speak" to me when read ..... as did this one. We made it exactly as written. It was flavorful, moist, and we enjoyed it, but it lacked any boldness. I think we will make it again and will consider either cayenne added to the mayo or a few chopped jalapenos.

Really easy to make, with minimal effort needed. So good, even my picky eater kids asked for seconds. I ended up mixing the avocado into the salad instead of serving it on the side. Makes plenty enough to serve a hungry family of four and still have leftovers. Big thumbs up!
Excellent chicken salad...
Very good. Only changes I made were to add about tablespoon of sour cream & appx teaspoon of cider vinegar to sharpen it up a little

Delicious and simple! It's like a BLT but without the bread and with chicken! Great with Thanksgiving/Christmas dinner as you can add in the turkey/chicken scraps from the giblets.

The ingredients are very simple but they marry beautifully with each other. I always loved tomato with mayo as the acidity cuts through the fattiness.
Delicious, especially with some black olives and tzatziki sauce
It is a great recipe if you eat all of it in one sitting. It does not retain the great flavors over night in a refrigerator. I would make it again.
It is a great recipe if you eat all of it in one sitting. It does not retain the great flavors over night in a refrigerator. I would make it again.
Made it with some left-over grilled chicken and it was great.

This is a perfect summer lunch. The combination of flavors with the creamy dressing was very good. I chilled it for a couple of hours before eating it. Very refreshing! I liked it so much that I think I'll make it again this week.
The creamy dressing enhanced the flavor of the ingredients.

We loved this recipe! I only had canned chicken, about 1 1/2 cups and filled in with 4 hard boiled eggs. I added 8 or 9 thinly sliced pimento stuffed green olives, and a dash of smoked paprika to the mayo. This recipe, with occasional variations, will be my go-to chicken salad recipe.
Excellent as is!!
My new favorite chicken salad!

I would add more bacon and tomatoes. Also, extra dressing would be nice. The greens needed a bit. To preserve extra salad, only add avocado to what is being served. 
Delicious salad!
Love blt but trying to Cut out carbs. Love it
Yummy!
it was very good and healthy... Try it!
I love this however, I used a ranch dressing and added blue cheese crumbles. It does taste good as a salad or a wrap. Very versatile.
I put the salad in flatbread and one recipe made about 10 burritos. Very good!!! Definitely will make again!
Excellent. Put in a wrap. Even Jake liked this on a bun.
This chicken salad is so good!!!! Highly recommend it just the way it is. No need to change a thing.
Delicious and refreshing!

I did add some breaded chicken to the mix as I didn't feel there was quite enough when I adjusted the servings. It needs something else so I added Ranch dressing to the finished product which helped the flavors.
I used half low fat mayo and half regular. Other than that, no changes. It was delicious and very attractive. The whole family loved it.

I made this and surprise my husband. I cut up the romain lettuce to make it easier to eat. The next day we put the salad in pita pockets! Delicious! However the next time I will cut down the mayo. A great dish to make for a ladies luncheon also.
Nothing special--better recipes for this type of salad on this site.
Might substitute half the mayo with sour cream next time, but it was good. Liked the flavor.

We made it as listed. Used an heirloom tomato because we could. We had leftover chicken from the crockpot and leftover bacon (three slices). This is quick and easy and great for a hot summer night. Great recipe!
Wonderful flavor

I didn't use celery, don't much care for it and hubby doesn't like it at all, I used parsley and chives seasoning instead of fresh. But it turned out very good. Even hubby liked it and he's picky. Will try to have fresh parsley sometime, Will make this again.Oh forgot I used Miracle Whip instead of mayo. Don't like mayo.
This was a great way to use leftover grilled chicken. I used in wraps and it was a yummy, filling, easy summer dinner!

Yum, this was so good! So refreshing to serve in the lettuce cups on a hot day. I went by the recipe and thought it needed a little more seasoning and I added in some garlic and onion powders. I didn't have avocado but I know it would of been delicious in this. I let it sit about 45 min. before eating and it was nice a flavorful and I loved the bacon in it. I will be having the leftovers today for lunch. I think this would be delicious served in tortillas layered with lettuce, if you wanted something a little more filling. I do think next time I will also replace a little bit of the mayo with sour cream. Overall it was great! Thank you for the recipe!
I'll make this short and sweet, I was told it was the best Chicken B.L. T. salad I have ever made. I didn't put in any celery and I didn't have wortherchire sauce so I used a dash of serrchia ( Sp?)

I used more than 3 cups of grilled chicken, turkey bacon, about half cup of mayo and more than 2 table spoons of green onion and lemon juice. I used plum tomatoes and deseeded them. This was an excellent and easy meal to prepare. I wished I had more parsley...
Did not have celery, used a cucumber instead.
Made this according to recipe, and it's tasty. I'll make it again.
I cut the recipe in half so that I could use a leftover roasted chicken breast. Even though my proportions were probably a little off, we really enjoyed this salad. I will definitely make it again!
Used cooked chicken breast from a recipe earlier in the week. Perfect for lunch. Loved another reviewer's suggestion to de-seed the tomato to avoid being watery. Used Greek yogurt and light mayo.

Excellent! Excellent! This will be a regular moving forward. Thank you! I'm desperately looking for yummy salads to get off rice and bread at night. This was an answered prayer. I used cilantro and light mayo. I did not have celery. I also did not have Worcestershire sauce so I used Braggs Amino Acid (soy sauce). Yum!!!!!
I made this and I thought it was awesome. I used bone in skin on chicken thighs and It turned out great.
It was delicious.

This chicken salad is delicious!! I make it often and everybody loves it. I made just a few small changes: I used 1 tsp. dried parsley and 1 tablespoon chopped green onion instead of 2 (I'm not a huge fan of strong onion flavor). I cooked my chicken in the oven at 350 for 20 minutes. I used 3 boneless breasts (trimmed and tenderized just a little with a meat mallet) and drizzled with olive oil, seasoned with salt & pepper. it turns out firm but tender. I like chunks in my chicken salad.

This was delicious and easy! Loved the bacon in it. Used what we had in the house, so no green onions but used red onions and they were a great addition. Not a huge fan of parsley, so we used basil. All and all, really great receipe. Thanks for sharing!

item.name: Chicken Salad with Bacon, Lettuce, and Tomato
